description: Number of primes between n and 4n+1.
example: a(5)=6 because between 5 and 21 there are 6 primes: 5, 7, 11, 13, 17 and 19.
maple: with(numtheory); A037038:=n->pi(4*n + 1) - pi(n - 1); seq(A037038(n), 1..100); # _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Feb 14 2014
mathematica: Table[PrimePi[4 n + 1] - PrimePi[n - 1], {n, 1, 100}] (* _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Feb 14 2014 *)
author: _Felice Russo_
